newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: CRICKET-SOUTH AUSTRALIA TAKE CHARGE AGAINST TASMANIA.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-SOUTH AUSTRALIA TAKE CHARGE AGAINST TASMANIA.

text.p: Opener Martin Faull scored an unbeaten half-century as South Australia took charge of their Sheffield Shield match against Tasmania on Thursday.
Faull scored 63 not out to steer the visitors to 127 for three in their second innings, a lead of 266 runs with seven wickets in hand, at close of play on the third day in Hobart.
Faull steadied the innings by adding 103 runs in an unbroken partnership with Geoff Parker, who remained on 39 not out.
Pace bowler Colin Miller briefly raised Tasmania's hopes by taking three quick wickets to reduce South Australia to 24 for three after 10 overs.
Discarded Australia test batsman Ricky Ponting earlier scored 126, more than half his side's total, as Tasmania made 248 in reply to South Australia's first innings 387.
South Australia all-rounder Joe Scuderi claimed five for 43 to add to his valuable 70 runs in the first innings.
His efforts helped South Australia, who prop up the Shield table, take the two competition points on offer for a first innings lead.
Tasmania must beat South Australia to move into second place in the standings behind Western Australia.
